heading: Deaths
txt: Hugo Junkers, German engineer, designed the Junkers J 1 (b. 1859)

entities.title: Hugo Junkers
entities.description: Hugo Junkers was a German aircraft engineer and aircraft designer who pioneered the design of all-metal airplanes and flying wings. His company, Junkers Flugzeug- und Motorenwerke AG, was one of the mainstays of the German aircraft industry in the years between World War I and World War II. His multi-engined, all-metal passenger- and freight planes helped establish airlines in Germany and around t

entities.title: Junkers J 1
entities.description: The Junkers J 1, nicknamed the Blechesel, was an experimental monoplane aircraft developed by Junkers & Co. It was the world's first all-metal aircraft.

heading: Deaths
txt: Yvette Guilbert, French singer and actress (b. 1865)

entities.title: Yvette Guilbert
entities.description: Yvette Guilbert was a French cabaret singer and actress of the Belle Époque.

heading: Deaths
txt: Roland Freisler, German lawyer and judge (b. 1893)

entities.title: Roland Freisler
entities.description: Roland Freisler was a German Nazi jurist, judge, and politician who served as the State Secretary of the Reich Ministry of Justice from 1934 to 1942 and President of the People's Court from 1942 to 1945.

heading: Deaths
txt: Marc Mitscher, American admiral and pilot (b. 1887)

entities.title: Marc Mitscher
entities.description: Marc Andrew "Pete" Mitscher was a pioneer in naval aviation who became an admiral in the United States Navy, and served as commander of the Fast Carrier Task Force in the Pacific during the latter half of World War II.

heading: Deaths
txt: Harold L. Ickes, American journalist and politician, 32nd United States Secretary of the Interior (b. 1874)

entities.title: Harold L. Ickes
entities.description: Harold LeClair Ickes was an American administrator and politician. He served as United States Secretary of the Interior for 13 years, from 1933 to 1946, the longest tenure of anyone to hold the office, and the second longest-serving Cabinet member in U.S. history after James Wilson. Ickes and Labor Secretary Frances Perkins were the only original members of the Roosevelt cabinet who remained in of

entities.title: United States Secretary of the Interior
entities.description: The United States secretary of the interior is the head of the United States Department of the Interior. The secretary and the Department of the Interior are responsible for the management and conservation of most federal land and natural resources, leading such agencies as the Bureau of Land Management, the United States Geological Survey, Bureau of Indian Affairs, and the National Park Service.

heading: Deaths
txt: Vasily Blokhin, Russian general (b. 1895)

entities.title: Vasily Blokhin
entities.description: Vasily Mikhailovich Blokhin was a Soviet Russian Major-General who served as the chief executioner of the Stalinist NKVD under the administrations of Genrikh Yagoda, Nikolai Yezhov, and Lavrentiy Beria.

heading: Deaths
txt: Émile Borel, French mathematician and academic (b. 1871)

entities.title: Émile Borel
entities.description: Félix Édouard Justin Émile Borel was a French mathematician and politician. As a mathematician, he was known for his founding work in the areas of measure theory and probability.

heading: Deaths
txt:
The Day the Music Died
The Big Bopper, American singer-songwriter and guitarist (b. 1930)
Buddy Holly, American singer-songwriter and guitarist (b. 1936)
Ritchie Valens, American singer-songwriter and guitarist (b. 1941)

entities.title: The Day the Music Died
entities.description: On February 3, 1959, American rock and roll musicians Buddy Holly, Ritchie Valens, and "The Big Bopper" J. P. Richardson were killed in a plane crash near Clear Lake, Iowa, together with pilot Roger Peterson. The event later became known as "The Day the Music Died", after singer-songwriter Don McLean referred to it as such in his 1971 song "American Pie".

heading: Deaths
txt: Fred Buscaglione, Italian singer and actor (b. 1921)

entities.title: Fred Buscaglione
entities.description: Ferdinando "Fred" Buscaglione was an Italian singer and actor who became very popular in the late 1950s. His public persona – the character he played both in his songs and his movies – was of a humorous mobster with a penchant for whisky and women.

heading: Deaths
txt: William Morrison, 1st Viscount Dunrossil, Scottish-Australian captain and politician, 14th Governor-General of Australia (b. 1893)

entities.title: William Morrison, 1st Viscount Dunrossil
entities.description: William Shepherd Morrison, 1st Viscount Dunrossil,, was a British politician. He was a long-serving cabinet minister before serving as Speaker of the House of Commons from 1951 to 1959. He was then appointed as the 14th Governor-General of Australia, in office from 1960 until his death in 1961.

entities.title: Governor-General of Australia
entities.description: The governor-general of Australia is the representative of the monarch, currently Queen Elizabeth II, in Australia. The governor-general is appointed by the monarch on the recommendation of government ministers. heading: Deaths
txt: Joe Meek, English songwriter and producer (b. 1929)

entities.title: Joe Meek
entities.description: Robert George "Joe" Meek was an English record producer, musician, sound engineer and songwriter who pioneered space age and experimental pop music. He also assisted the development of recording practices like overdubbing, sampling and reverberation. Meek is considered one of the most influential sound engineers of all time, being one of the first to develop ideas such as the recording studio as a

heading: Deaths
txt: C. N. Annadurai, Indian journalist and politician, 7th Chief Minister of Madras State (b. 1909)

entities.title: C. N. Annadurai
entities.description: Conjeevaram Natarajan Annadurai, popularly known as Anna also known as Arignar Anna or Perarignar Anna, was an Indian politician who served as the fifth and last Chief Minister of Madras State from 1967 until 1969 and first Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu for 20 days before his death. He was the first member of a Dravidian party to hold either post.

entities.title: List of Chief Ministers of Tamil Nadu
entities.description: The Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu is the chief executive of the Indian state of Tamil Nadu. In accordance with the Constitution of India, the governor is a state's de jure head, but de facto executive authority rests with the chief minister. Following elections to the Tamil Nadu Legislative Assembly, the state's governor usually invites the party with a majority of seats to form the government. The

heading: Deaths

heading: Deaths
txt: William D. Coolidge, American physicist and engineer (b. 1873)

entities.title: William D. Coolidge
entities.description: William David Coolidge was an American physicist and engineer, who made major contributions to X-ray machines. He was the director of the General Electric Research Laboratory and a vice-president of the corporation. He was also famous for the development of "ductile tungsten", which is important for the incandescent light bulb.

entities.title: Frank Oppenheimer
entities.description: Frank Friedman Oppenheimer was an American particle physicist, cattle rancher, professor of physics at the University of Colorado, and the founder of the Exploratorium in San Francisco.

heading: Deaths
txt: John Cassavetes, American actor, director, and screenwriter (b. 1929)

entities.title: John Cassavetes
entities.description: John Nicholas Cassavetes was an American actor, film director, and screenwriter. First known as an actor on television and in film, Cassavetes also became a pioneer of American independent cinema, writing and directing movies financed in part with income from his acting work. entities.description: Nancy Jane Kulp was an American character actress and comedienne best known as Miss Jane Hathaway on the CBS television series The Beverly Hillbillies.

entities.title: Françoys Bernier
entities.description: Françoys Joseph Arthur Maurice Bernier was a Canadian pianist, conductor, radio producer, arts administrator, and music educator. He served as the music director of the Montreal Festivals from 1956 to 1960 and was an active conductor and a producer for CBC Radio during the 1950s and early 1960s. heading: Deaths
txt: Audrey Meadows, American actress and banker (b. 1922)

entities.title: Audrey Meadows
entities.description: Audrey Meadows was an American actress best known for her role as the deadpan housewife Alice Kramden on the 1950s American television comedy The Honeymooners. She was the younger sister of Hollywood leading lady Jayne Meadows.

entities.title: Gwen Guthrie
entities.description: Gwendolyn "Gwen" Guthrie was an American singer-songwriter and pianist who also sang backing vocals for Aretha Franklin, Billy Joel, Stevie Wonder, Peter Tosh, and Madonna, among others, and who wrote songs made famous by Ben E. entities.title: Zurab Zhvania
entities.description: Zurab Zhvania was a Georgian politician, who served as Prime Minister of Georgia and Speaker of the Parliament of Georgia. Zhvania began his political career at young age, making his first political steps as a member of Green Party, in the beginning of 90s. entities.description: The prime minister of Georgia is the head of government and chief executive of Georgia. The prime minister organizes, directs, and controls the functions of the Government and signs the legal acts of the government. They appoint and dismiss ministers in the government. heading: Deaths
txt: Al Lewis, American actor and activist (b. 1923)

entities.title: Al Lewis (actor)
entities.description: Al Lewis was an American actor best known for his role as Count Dracula lookalike Grandpa on the television series The Munsters from 1964 to 1966 and its film versions. Later in life, he was a restaurant owner, political candidate, and radio broadcaster.

heading: Deaths
txt: Sheng-yen, Chinese monk and scholar, founded the Dharma Drum Mountain (b. 1930)

entities.title: Sheng-yen
entities.description: Sheng Yen, born Zhang Baokang, was a Chinese Buddhist monk, a religious scholar, and one of the mainstream teachers of Chan Buddhism. He was a 57th generational dharma heir of Linji Yixuan in the Linji school and a third-generation dharma heir of Hsu Yun. entities.title: Dharma Drum Mountain
entities.description: Dharma Drum Mountain is an international Buddhist spiritual, cultural, and educational foundation founded by late Chan master Sheng-yen. The center focuses on educating the public in Buddhism with the goal of improving the world and establishing a "Pure Land on Earth" through Buddhist education. A member of the Democratic Party, she was the fourth African-American woman in Congress and the first to represent the Midwest. entities.title: Chief Minister of Balochistan
entities.description: The Chief Minister of Balochistan is elected by the Provincial Assembly of the Balochistan to serve as the head of the provincial government in Balochistan, Pakistan. The position had been held by Jam Kamal Khan in 2018 elections.

heading: Deaths
txt: Martin Gilbert, English historian, author, and academic (b. 1936)

entities.title: Martin Gilbert
entities.description:
Sir Martin John Gilbert was a British historian and honorary Fellow of Merton College, Oxford. He was the author of eighty-eight books, including works on Winston Churchill, the 20th century, and Jewish history including the Holocaust.
He was a member of the Chilcot Inquiry into Britain's role in the Iraq War.

entities.title: Chief Justice of Pakistan
entities.description: The chief justice of Pakistan is the head of the court system of Pakistan and the chief judge of the Supreme Court of Pakistan. The officeholder is the senior most of 17 senior justices of the Supreme Court of Pakistan.

entities.description: Balram Jakhar was an Indian politician, a parliamentarian and Governor of Madhya Pradesh.

entities.title: Governor of Madhya Pradesh
entities.description: The Governor of Madhya Pradesh is a nominal head and representative of the President of India in the state of Madhya Pradesh. The Governor is appointed by the President for a period of 5 years.

heading: Deaths
txt: Dritëro Agolli, Albanian poet, writer and politician (b. 1931)

entities.title: Dritëro Agolli
entities.description: Dritëro Agolli was an Albanian poet, writer, politician, and former president of the Albanian League of Writers and Artists. He studied in Leningrad in the Soviet Union, and wrote primarily poetry, but also short stories, essays, plays, and novels. He was head of the Albanian League of Writers and Artists from 1973 until 1992. He was a leading figure in the Albanian Communist nomenklatura.

heading: Deaths

entities.title: Julie Adams
entities.description: Julie Adams was an American actress, billed as Julia Adams toward the beginning of her career, primarily known for her numerous television guest roles. She starred in a number of films in the 1950s, including Bend of the River (1952) opposite James Stewart and Creature from the Black Lagoon (1954). heading: Deaths

heading: Deaths
txt: George Steiner, French-American philosopher, author, and critic (b. 1929)

entities.title: George Steiner
entities.description: Francis George Steiner, FBA was a Franco-American literary critic, essayist, philosopher, novelist, and educator. He wrote extensively about the relationship between language, literature and society, and the impact of the Holocaust. An article in The Guardian described Steiner as a "polyglot and polymath".
